questions.prompt: In BG 1.1, why is Kuruksetra called a special place?
questions.feedback: Kuruksetra is a holy place. This means what is right is supported there, and Krsna is guiding events.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.1, what does Dhritarastra ask Sanjaya?
choices: What is happening on the battlefield
questions.feedback: Dhritarastra asks what his sons and the Pandavas are doing. He feels worried about what will happen next.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.14, what do Krsna and Arjuna do before the battle?
questions.feedback: Krsna and Arjuna blow their conchshells. The strong sound gives courage and hope to their side.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.20, what does Arjuna do after seeing the Kaurava army?
questions.feedback: Arjuna lifts his bow and prepares to speak. He is brave and ready to understand the situation.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.21-1.22, what does Arjuna ask Krsna to do?
choices: Place the chariot between the armies
questions.feedback: Arjuna asks Krsna to place the chariot between the armies. Krsna kindly helps him.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.26, whom does Arjuna see on both sides?
questions.feedback: Arjuna sees many relatives and teachers. This shows he has a caring and gentle heart.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.27, how does Arjuna feel after seeing his relatives?
questions.feedback: Arjuna feels sad because he cares about his family. It is okay to feel this way.

questions.prompt: Why does Arjuna feel sad when he sees his family on both sides?
choices: Because he wants to win prizes
questions.feedback: Arjuna feels sad because he loves and cares for his family. Krsna will help him understand what to do.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.28, what happens to Arjuna's body?
questions.feedback: Arjuna says his limbs are weak. Krsna is nearby and will guide him.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.46, what does Arjuna do at the end of Chapter 1?
questions.feedback: Krsna will now help Arjuna understand what to do.
